frame.name: Submitting_documents
frame.definition:
<def-root>A <fen>Submittor</fen> gives <fen>Documents</fen> to an <fen>Authority</fen> so that they can be processed as part of an application, evaluation or other official or bureaucratic process.
<ex>I was sure I had passed as soon as <fex name="Submittor">I</fex> <t>handed</t> <t>in</t> <fex name="Documents">the test</fex>. <fex name="Authority">DNI</fex></ex>
<ex>She stated that <fex name="Submittor">she</fex> <t>turned</t> <t>in</t> <fex name="Documents">the paperwork</fex> <fex name="Time">yesterday</fex>.</ex>
<ex>After <fex name="Submittor">the applicant's</fex> <t>submission</t> <fex name="Authority">to the department</fex>, the department chairperson must evaluate.</ex>
<ex>I acknowledge <fex name="Submittor">my</fex> <t>submission</t> <fex name="Documents">of the Material</fex> <fex name="Authority">to you</fex> shall not lead to a concurrent review by any of your affiliate and subsidiary channels.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Submittor
FE.definition: <def-root>The person that begins in possession of the <fen>Documents</fen> and gives them over into the possession of the <fen>Authority</fen> for processing. <ex>The Human Services financial worker cannot decide if you will get food support benefits until <fex name="Submittor">you</fex> <t>turn</t> <t>in</t> the form and needed verifications.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Authority
FE.definition:
<def-root>The individual or organization that ends up in possession of the <fen>Documents</fen> and processes them.
<ex>If an application is late, whether you <t>submitted</t> it late <fex name="aut">to us</fex> or it was held up at your Command, NMETC will not be able to fund registration fees.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Documents
FE.definition:
<def-root>The artifacts containing content, typically in the form of text and images, that the Submittor gives to the <fen>Authority</fen>.
<ex>Once you have <t>submitted</t> <fex name="doc">the form</fex>, a request to make an oral statement will be generated based on the information you supplied.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Place
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Place</fen> where the <fen>Submittor</fen> gives the <fen>Documents</fen> to the <fen>Authority</fen>.</def-root>

FE.name: Explanation
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Explanation</fen> denotes a proposition from which event of the <fen>Submittor</fen>'s giving the <fen>Documents</fen> to the <fen>Authority</fen> logically follows.
<ex>Two of the establishments <t>submitted</t> the application <fex name="exp">because they were producing a new product</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Time
FE.definition: <def-root>The time period during which the <fen>Submittor</fen> gives the <fen>Documents</fen> to the <fen>Authority</fen>.</def-root>

FE.name: Purpose
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Purpose</fen> for which the <fen>Submittor</fen> gives the <fen>Documents</fen> to the <fen>Authority</fen>.</def-root>

FE.name: Means
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Means</fen> by which the <fen>Submittor</fen> gives the <fen>Documents</fen> to the <fen>Authority</fen>.</def-root>

FE.name: Manner
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Manner</fen> is the manner in which the <fen>Submittor</fen> gives the <fen>Documents</fen> to the <fen>Authority</fen>.
<ex>The company <fex name="Man">hastily</fex> <t>submitted</t> the manuscript to three additional reviewers.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Depictive
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE describes a participant of the state of affairs introduced by the target as being in some state during the action. The depicted state does not necessarily or usually facilitate or cause the state of affairs reported by the target. </def-root>

FE.name: Beneficiary
FE.definition: <def-root>This extra-thematic FE applies to participants that derive a benefit from the occurrence of the event specified by the target predicate. Further, the target predicate should involve some sort of agent that intends that the benefit go to the Beneficiary.</def-root>

lexUnit.name: submit.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: present (a proposal or application) for consideration or judgement.

lexUnit.name: submission.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: the act of presenting (a proposal or application) for consideration or judgement.

lexUnit.name: hand in.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: hand something over to (an authority)

lexUnit.name: turn in.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: hand something in (to an authority)

lexUnit.name: file.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: Submit document to be placed in a file.
